website_summaries.verdict: One of the lightest pottery wheels we came across at a great price.
pros: Owners rave over how durable and sturdy this iron pottery wheel is
Spins with very little wobble (if a little slowly) making it a great choice if you primarily work on small details on your work
cons: Surface could rust if it gets wet and isn't dried promptly

customer_reviews.title: METAL POTTERY WHEEL EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my new pottery banding wheel... It is a little heavier than I thought it would be, but spins great and very stable. I used it while painting underglaze onto my pottery before firing....works like a charrn. I plan to also use for some clay hand building ...
customer_reviews.author: Lind S

customer_reviews.title: Mack Truck, not a Ballerina.
customer_reviews.text: Very stable and solid to handle heavy loads. Turns smoothly without any wobble or play. Turntable is nicely finished and FLAT. Would benefit from addition of ball bearing mount, which would increase its utility as a banding wheel, and get a 5 star rating outta' me. An additional note: don't confuse this with an identical product that IS ball-bearing mounted but is $10 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased customer~!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is an excellent buy~!! I am very pleased with the weight and the spin~!! It's heavy but not too heavy...and it spins very smoothly~!! This will be an excellent addition to my studio~!! There is a tiny, slight hint of a wobble, but I don't think it is significant enough to be noticed (If it effects decorating my pots evenly, I'll come back and update my review) ...even if it did...for the price and quality of what was received, I would recommend this without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Good, heavy weight and turns smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Love this for my clay work. I didn't want to spend a fortune on a banding wheel and this fit the bill perfectly. It's heavy weight won't tip under any circumstances I've found, it spins beautifully without a hint of a wobble, and the finish is perfect. I took it to a class last month and had several people ask how much and where I got it. They were all surprised at how reasonable the price was and most stated they were going to look it up and order one based on seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Megara

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to work on when I make concrete flower pots. It turns so easily and will hold things that get pretty heavy, especially like concrete. Makes working on all sides very easy. If you leave it outside like I do, be sure to cover it with plastic so it does not get wet or it will rust.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cast iron for 1/4 the price of a Shimpo
customer_reviews.text: Cast iron, not aluminum, but spins smoothly and good value for 1/4 the price of the Shimpo brand professional banding wheel. Time will tell if it rusts through the paint or enamel in the damp pottery studio environment.
customer_reviews.author: Villagepotter

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but rust
customer_reviews.text: this is heavy .. does the job. I like it.Tghe top is a bit ruff... and rust has started to set in.
customer_reviews.author: this and that

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, unlevel turn table heads
customer_reviews.text: This product has been replaced due to the turntable being out of level on the first one. If you tried to use this for its design purpose it would ruin the quality of your art... Don’t buy it... I am Returning the replacement and will not attempt a third...Time for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: jimmersgal

customer_reviews.title: Best pottery tool I have
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't like without this banding wheel. There are some that are smaller and less expensive but I'm glad I bought this size and the weight is substantial which keeps it spinning for a long time. Love it - very useful for all kinds of projects.
customer_reviews.author: MsAlwaysRight

customer_reviews.title: Great for ceramics!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my ceramic projects! I wish the wheel was able to spin a little more freely for slip and glaze application but it still works great! I just have to manually spin it a little bit extra. Great for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Caudill

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality!
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered this item, but I am glad I did! It is awesome for designing pottery and other things you may need a turntable for. It’s extremely sturdy and turns very smoothly. I have used wet clay on it and left it sitting, there has been no rust at all. Very high quality for the price. I would recommend this to anyone who is contemplating purchasing it! You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Alloe

customer_reviews.title: Not smooth at all
customer_reviews.text: The item that was delivered to me barely rotated and the rotation was the opposite of smooth. Something inside was off, it was making noise and obstructed the rotation. I had to return the item and purchased something else.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Tiraspolsky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Feels like it will last long enough to pass on to my next of kin.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Quality 10
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty. Spinning is easy and consistent. Perfect for painting my pottery and frosting my cakes.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A. Cool

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed at all, Barely turns a revolution and then slows down. Save your time and money and buy a quality brand name version.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed by the heftiness and the smooth rotation of this product. I would definitely recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Kleinke

customer_reviews.title: Some blemishes
customer_reviews.text: Some blemishes on the turntable but the bearings run smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well-made. Operates beautifully. Will probably outlive me!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grandstaff

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical based on the price point of this item but it was worth every penny. Extremely sturdy & weighted well for a smooth spin.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin C.

customer_reviews.title: Be easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and stable. Just as advertised. Be easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: James Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. Wheel turns smoothly. Has good weight to it. Has definitely made working on my projects easier. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The quality is impressive
customer_reviews.text: I really love how sturdy this banding wheel is. It is way better than the ones provided by my school and I enjoy using it to work on my pottery at home.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy wheel!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great turntable. I use it for spinning large pottery pieces as I mosaic. Very sturdy, spins easily and looks as though it’s gonna last a lifetime! Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Momma-doo

customer_reviews.title: Potters' Friend
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, although not convenient for hauling around. Quite heavy, thus it's terrific sturdiness!
customer_reviews.author: RBHanna

customer_reviews.title: Very Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and heavy duty! Great for a ceramic/pottery studio!
customer_reviews.author: joshua92

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave clay to dry on wheel
customer_reviews.text: I really like it. I love it. However, I left my clay on it so it can dry a bit and it left it a bit rusty (I’m not sure if that’s considered rust) It was probably my fault however I’ve left clay to dry a bit on wheels before and it didn’t leave a mark. Would I buy again? Yeah but I wouldn’t leave my clay on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.  As Expected.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to pottery and just joined a beginner hand building class. This banding wheel is perfect for me to bring to and from our weekly sessions. Do note that it is on the heavy side, but that is what makes it sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas City Mom

product_meta.title: Falling in Art Heavy Duty Metal Pottery Decorating Banding Wheel, 12 Inches Diameter
product_meta.description:
Size:12 inch MetalFalling in Art 12‘’ diameter metal banding wheel

Product Dimensions
Turntable work area diameter:7 inches in diameter,8 2/3 inches in diameter,9 2/5 inches in diameter 
Chassis diameter:7 1/5 inches in diameter
Height: 4 1/3 inches
Weight: 8.40 pounds
Material: iron,rubber

Kindly Note
1.Please not place it on the edge of the desktop.
2.Place in a dry environment to extend product life.
feature_bullets: MULTI-FUNCTION - - Can be used for sculptor or decorator working in pottery,clay design,model-marking and other artistic work
WITHOUT ELECTRICITY - - Made of indestructible iron wheel can be slowly manual rotation for fine detail artwork
EASY PLACE - - Can be moved easily by hands; Chassis is equipped with rubber pad and holds the wheel firmly
SUITABLE HEIGHT - - 4 1/3 inches high,can turn the turntable easily
NONSLIP SURFACE - - When turning, even a piece of paper placed on top will not slip easily

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars171 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
